The Workman's Friend

[@cr-line1] When things go wrong

And will not come right[@cr-line2]

Though you do the best you can[@cr-line3]

When life looks black[@cr-line4]

As the hour of night[@cr-line5]

A pint of plain is your only man[@cr-line6]

When moneyâ€™s tight[@cr-line7]

And hard to get[@cr-line8]

And your horse has also ran[@cr-line9]

When all you have is a heap of debt[@cr-line10]

A pint of plain is your only man[@cr-line11]

When health is bad and your heart feels strange[@cr-line12]

And your face is pale and wan[@cr-line13]

When doctors say you need a change[@cr-line14]

A pint of plain is your only man[@cr-line15]

When food is scarce[@cr-line16]

And your larder bare[@cr-line17]

And no rashers grease your pan[@cr-line17]

When hunger grows as your meals are rare[@cr-line18]

A pint of plain is your only man[@cr-line19]

In time of trouble and lousey strife[@cr-line20]

You have still got a darlint plan[@cr-line21]

You still can turn to a brighter life[@cr-line22]

A pint of plain is your only man[@cr-line23]
